data.name: Power Trader [PART 1]: Product hours
data.description:
I have decided to create series of Katas based on real examples from power/utilities (and especially trading) area. I think that it may be refreshing to try something more practical. First we begin with something simple.

Task

Your task is to calculate how many hours are valid between two given dates for specified products. Products are following:
  • Base load
    • - all days, all hours
  • Peak load
    • - only working days, 8:00-20:00
  • Off-Peak load
    • - during working days 00:00 - 08:00 and 20:00 - 00:00, during weekends all hours
Input will have form of two dates in [C++: dd.mm.yyyy, Java: dd.MM.yyyy) format and product as one of strings "BASE", "PEAK", "OFFPEAK".

Example

First example is to calculate number of valid hours between 1.11.2016 (Tuesday) and 7.11.2016 (Monday) for base load, which should return 168 ```number of days * number of hours``` For same dates, but Peak load product, function should return ```{number of working days} * 12```, which is in this case 5 * 12 = 60. For offpeak product, it is ```{number of working days} * 12 + {number of weekend days} * 24``` = 5 * 12 + 2 * 24 = 108. Don't forget to take leap years into account! :-) Holidays are irrelevant (will be part 2), and bonus for you is, when you will solve it without using loops
